description: Blowfish symmetric encryption implementation with Feistel network structure, P-array, and S-boxes for variable-length key encryption

analysis_points: Blowfish symmetric cipher with Feistel network design
P-array with 18 subkeys for encryption rounds
F-function using S-box lookups and modular arithmetic
quantum_threats: Grover's algorithm reduces effective key strength by half
64-bit block size susceptible to birthday attacks

evaluation_criteria: Recognition of Blowfish P-array and S-box structure
Knowledge of small block size vulnerabilities
